column1: #Text=Have you ever run for political office before ?
#Text=( President , senate , congress , city councillor , school trustee ... etc. )
#Text=Have you ever been a member of a political party , other than the one you 're currently in ?
#Text=No [ I have n't run for before ] .
#Text=Yes , for years I was a member of the Republican Party back when it believed in fiscal responsibility and smaller government .
#Text=For the last 10 years I was registered as an Independent and I recently became a member of the New American Independent Party .
#Text=Have you ever campaigned for another political candidate ?
#Text=No.
#Text=What is your current job ?
#Text=My current job is President and CFO for a group of small , privately owned companies .

#Text=Although I have managed companies that have been involved in a wide cross section of different industries , the vast majority of my work experience has been in various sectors of the real estate industry .
#Text=What skills or ideas do you bring from this position , or previous positions , that will benefit the Oval Office ?
#Text=During my career I have been called on many times to straighten out problems and get things moving in the right direction .
#Text=I am a problem solver who can make the tough decisions to get things done and back on track .
#Text=The problem with almost all politicians these days is that they are politicians and only care about what they need to do to win the next election .
#Text=What this country needs are statesmen who will look at the big picture and do what is right for all Americans .

#Text=You do n’t make everyone happy doing that , the same as you ca n’t always make everyone happy in your business , but if you keep the long-term view it will turn out better for all concerned and make for a stronger more vibrant country that benefits everyone .
#Text=Obviously , the next American President and his or her administration will face many diverse issues .
#Text=But if you were to narrow identify the three most important issues , what would they be ?
#Text=How will you address these issues ?
#Text=First , the biggest problem facing us now and for generations to come is our dependence on foreign sources of oil and oil in general .
#Text=We need to immediately start a " Manhattan Project " for energy independence .

#Text=We put a man on the moon back in the " dark ages " of technology and I firmly believe that we have the brain power to come up with solutions to the world 's energy problems if only we apply ourselves and our resources to the task .
#Text=We are quickly on our way towards spending $ 1,000,000,000,000 ( that ’s a trillion ) of your tax dollars on the war in Iraq .

#Text=If that money had instead been pointed towards new research and development into fuel cells , hydrogen , solar , wind and other technologies , I believe we would already be well on our way to major break-throughs in renewable and alternative energy solutions .
